intro: Saussurea pseudoplatyphyllaria, commonly known as the Tibetan saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and yellowish-orange flower heads. The plant produces small, composite flowers that are typically arranged in a single terminal head. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
